subject: Re: [junit] Passing Arguments to an ANT Buildfile
msgSnippet: ... Is there a reason for you to care? It would seem to me to be a mistake to pass . George McKinney ghmck@shaw.ca
messageBody:
>
> This way, if I don't mention the property, i.e. if I call ant without
> arguments (ant), it executes perfectly, running the DefaultTestCase.
> But if I send a blank property (ant -Dtestfile=""), junit doesn't
> know which test to run, because he looks for a test named "".
>
Is there a reason for you to care? It would seem to me to be a mistake to
pass "".

George McKinney
ghmck@...

=========================================================
An experienced developer knows that it is seldom wise to
prefix a demonstration with anything more predictive than
"Watch this" - unless there is a good test suite in place.
